alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 3:12AM MDT until June 22 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following counties, Elbert and Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 615 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 312 AM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Karval, Punkin Center, Forder, Wild Horse Point, Kutch and Boyero.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
